text: Cloudy honey color. Faint fruit and fair amount of complex funk. Sip- great fruit and tang. Drink- more funk and attack. Hella dry.
Backlog z Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Amerykańska odpowiedź na Fou Foune z Cantillon. Potężny funk i brzoskwinie, soczyste, skórzaste, intensywnie kwaśne, wytrawne. Wyśmienite piwo.
MBCC. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, tart, little lemon, fruit and sour. Flavour is malt, tart, little lemo, fruits, sour, little dry and medium sweet.

White wine, citrus fruits, bit of brett. Pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sour. More citrus fruits, lemon and lime juice, acidic, sour grapes, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Decent Sour. Keg at MBCC Yellow Session, Copenhagen.
MBCC. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, bretty, lemon and fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 120517

Bottle at the crazy tasting at my place. Pours a hazy orange color with a medium white head. Sharp woody apricot nose. The flavor is rich soft meaty peaches, bigger sour, woody, lactic sour cultures. Very sharp but smooth and drinkable. Lovely.

Bottle from a friend. Slightly hazy yellow color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, earthy notes, apricot, oak, minerals, acidic notes and grass. Sour finish with citrus, apricot, grass, earthy notes, minerals and a bit of ripe fruits. Excellent sour ale.

Bottle. Thanks!

A: Peach in color with a thin orange head.

N: Peach, apricot, grapefruit, lemon, straw, green apple, oak, and funk.

T: Sour and lightly sweet.

M: Light body, no alcohol, crisp carbonation.

O: Very good. Much better than the 1st batch Ive had previously. The fruit comes through more and theres better character to the beer itself.

(On tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen, May 9/17) Pours a hazy medium gold with a small, stable white head. Aroma is loads of tart, semi-ripe apricots, zesty citrus, apricot skin, hints of wine, a little acidic bite, oaky hints, slightly cheesy sort of funk. On the tongue, rather tart but still juicy apricot flesh, pit fruit skins, wine, a little lemon curd, drying with increased oak component, funk with hay and light cheese, finishing dry, lots of lingering apricot flesh and peel, some bite even in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with soft creamy carbonation. Really apricot forward, the wine character of the barrels is integrated and not dominant, typical SARA treatment. Nice sour!
Keg at cbc17 yellow hazy amber.. Thin white lacing.. Soft herbal fruit nose. Dry zezty fruits.. Sharp citrus
Sample at MBCC 2017. Hazy orange with a small white head. Fairly sour with light apricot, funk, malt and light grass. Kind of easy to drink.
Bottle at Portland tasting. White soft foam. Mostly clear lemon yellow. Soft funk, good fresh lambic character. Completely delicious. Great apricot funk. Fantastic.
Tap @MBCC2017, Yellow Session. Cloudy yellow, white head. Citrusy aroma, mild funky notes. Citrusy, slightly funky flavour. Has some fruity bitterness. Refreshing carb, long citric bite.

duft: malt malt sødme citrus kant mandel mel 
smag: frisk citrus lime appelsin frisk tør

12.05.2017, tap @ MBCC:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, hazy. Aroma is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, fruit salt, fruit stones, grass, sour fruits, oak, hay, minerals, hay,hints of spices. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish mineraly, soda powder, fruit salt, fruit stones, sorrel, sour apricots, hay, weeds, grass, berry skin, unripe berries. Medium bitterness, dry sour-ish mouthfeel. Nice.
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Yellow Session. Trübes goldgelbes Bier. Geruch ist mild säuerlich, Kraut, Eiche. Geschmack ist mild säuerlich, limetten, Kraut, toll.

0,05l from tap at MBCC yellow session shared with / by the crew. orange cloudy color, small white head. smells of funk, light berry notes, citric, bit grassy. nice smell. full body, very soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, grassy, wood, marzipan, nutty, light funk. finishes lightly sour and dry with notes of grass, citric and marzipan. very nice one. smell is not super special but taste is quite nice. gets better once it warms

7, 4, 8, 4, 17

Tap @ MBCC. Hazy yellow pure white head. Dust, apricots, apples, sour notes. Quite sour indeed with balanced apple flavour, cant detect the apricots. A great style-typical saison but not quite the 100th percentile IMO.

Tap, mbcc yellow. 
Deep golden color, thick white head. 
Funky nose, green apples, mild vinegar. 
Vinegar, tartness, apples. Hard core.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Dryness, sourness, berries, some tartness and some spices.
Keg. Hazy golden with a small white head. Fairly sour with dust, sour berries, hay, peach and apricot. Medium body, mild sweet, medium sour. Long sour finish with apricot.
Hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is lime, flowers and abrikot. Taste is peach, malt and vinegear.
Sample at MBCC2017. It pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Acidic aroma. Fruity notes. Medium sweet flavor with acidic vinegar notes. Light apricot.
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Hazy yellow color, white head. Sour aroma has apricots, fruits and farm notes. Nice sour taste, apricots, farm notes.
Pours hazy golden with flat white head. Aroma of green grapes, grass, elderflower, citrus. Taste is rich tart with a mellow sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Pours hazy golden with minimal head 
Aromas tart and funky of apricot, citrusy fruits, green grapes, green apples 
Taste has tart notes of apricot, peach, citrusy fruits, green apples, some funk

Pours hazy peach with a moderate frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, kiwi, apricot, green apples, green grapes. Taste is very fruity and quite sour with farmhouse notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied and quite dry with medium carbonation. Wow.

From draft at Himmeriget. Lovely hazy yellow/orange. Very acidic and fruit-forward as one would expect from this staple of American sours. Apricots, lemon, vinous, acidic, straw. Lingering sourness. Lovely.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Orange coloured pour with white head and lacing. Sour fruity aroma and taste with prominent apricot fruity notes, some citrus fruity backing, medium acidic, tart fruity apricot finish.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grainy and slight sourish. Lingering sour, wineous and fruity. Sour and smooth fruity far finish.

Holy tartness. Lemon, apricots, passion fruit, super acidic, natural sweetness. Some oak and vinous notes lying in the background. Aftertaste is wonderful, the burning acidic tartness gently fades away without being overwhelming. I can see why this is so highly rated. Top notch.

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, wine , apricot, malt, and straw. The flavor is sour with notes of lemons, spricot, wheat, and brettanomyces, leading to a tart finish.

Really hazy golden color with a bit of white foam. Aroma has lots of unripe apricots and lemony funk. Taste starts with tart, unripe apricots, stonefruit skin, acidic fruit juice, really dry finish. Light body, really dry, medium carbonation. Overall its a great, fruity sour. Very refreshing and easy drinking.
Cloudy yellow color, white head. Nice aroma of stone fruit and tropical fruit. Taste is lightly tart mixed summer fruit. Very tasty.
Draft at brewvival. Nose is super tart with lemon and funk. Hazy yellow gold. Minimal head. Taste is initially puckering. Light funkinesss. Light cheese. Very solid. Light vinegar and gravely.

Clear golden color with a thin off white head. Very funky with some apricot and wood in the nose. More fruit in the taste - lightly tart with subtle sweetness. Lively carb, fairly light bodied, and crisp. Delicate finish of apricots.

Bottle split as part of a share. Incredible -- this has everything Im looking for in a fruited sour beer. The base beer has got a moderately-high sour bite, but it still shows a lot of the wine-barrel saison character that SARA does so well. Theres a lot apricot aroma and flavor in here as well, which adds that perfect drying tannin-y sensation that sets the best sours apart. Big but balanced, sour but not overpowering, fruity but refined -- this is one of the very, very best beers Ive ever had.

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours deep orange with a white head. Apricots, orange, funk and yeast. Tart and lactic with a clear note of vinegar. Tasty okay but very unrefined. Why is this rated so High? Handsome label BTW.
Bottle @ Himmeriget. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Apricot, oak, vinegar, disappointed.

A 750ml bottle at Himmergiet with no discernible bottled on date on the bottle although the menu states that it was 2016. Poured into a mini wine glass. It poured a hazy golden straw colour with a minimal white head and sparse lacing. Aromas gave an initial whiff of something that reminded me of tuna salad followed by tart, apricot, berries, funk, grass and hay. Tastes sour, tart, apricot, raspberry and cranberry. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, this was my first SARA beer and it was a very enjoyable and refreshing sour. Now I really want to get my hands on more West Ashley and other SARA beers if possible. Just not so easy for me
Such a great beer -- very well-balanced, lots of apricots. Perfect for a hot summer day.

Bottle share. Yellow pour with a thin white head. Aromatic with apricot, funk, and wine barrel. Tastes sour with fruity apricot bits, accents from the wine barrel. Well balanced fruity and sour elements, finishes crisp and clean. Moderate acidity. This is really nice.

Bottle first sample at Culmination Fest: Poured a bright yellow with white head. Aroma was pungent fruit mainly apricots and heavy oak. Taste was sour acidic fruit that slaps the palate right in the face. Very alive!

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 Flaska direkt från Sante Adairius som hade turen att hamna hos min amerikanske vän och granne. Finns på Esquires lista över "The 10 Best Beers Youll Never Taste". En djupt disig, aprikosfärgad vätska som närmast liknar nyponsoppa eller billig mulltivitamindryck. Stor, syrlig doft med mängder av överjästa aprikoser, syrliga aprikoskärnor, höiga stalltoner och med ett litet inslag av nyponsylt. En aningen större kropp som drar något åt det torrare hållet, samtidigt som det finns en oljig tendens. Den fyller munnen väl och är stor i smaken. Inledningsvis en stor syrlighet som efter en stund får det att strama åt bak i munnen. Liksom i lukten är här mycket aprikos och aprikoskärnor. När den första vågen är över framträder mer subtila delar av smakbilden, där fruktsötma och lite strävare ekfatstoner får ta plats. Dessa ligger kvar länge i den långsamt skiftande smakbilden. Riktigt gott med en komplex och växande smakbild. Den tappar liksom aldrig stinget.
(En fût au Hamiltons Tavern): Des abricots dans une marre boisée, acétique, minérale et vigoureusement asséchante. Très intense et difficile à suivre comparativement à la moyenne SARA.
Bottle pour at FoFa. West Ashley  --- Bright gold, soft body,  good acidity fruit but also a nutty character. 3.8

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Bottle himmeriget. Pours hazy orange with a with a white head. Aroma of barnyard, fruity, light apricot, some herbal minty thing, grapes, woody, quite acidic. Taste is rather sour, light fruity, vinegar, apricots, wood and grapes. Rough and heavy sour.

Sampled from 0.75 l bottle, shared by Maakun at Not THT, thanks! Slightly hazy, golden amber with a white head. Sourish-fruity, moderately funky aroma of peach, barnyard, lemon peel, gooseberry, wheat and oak. Moderately sour, very fruity and quite funky taste of peach, gooseberry, lemon peel, rhubarb, oak, wheat and barnyard, followed by a medium long, quite tart and woody-dry finish. Medium body, tangy, slightly effervescent and quite astringent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really good!

Bottle courtesy of Maakun. Hazy golden, minimal white head. Sour grain, grapes, hay, grass, bit lactic, light metallic and dusty. Medium sour, minerallike saltiness. About medium body, minerallike texture. Soft carbonation. Bit herbal touch.

Bottle shared. Hazy golden orange with fizzy almost white head. Apricots, some mineral notes, lactic, but of funk, dough, white wine, green leaves, soft spicy notes, some unexpected roasted touches to it. Its nice and fruity but with almost as much grapes as apricots. Medium sour and very light bitter. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation.

75cl bottle shared at not THT.
Thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. A bit sour. Some apricots

Bottle shared thanks to Maakun. Hazy pale golden with a white head. Notes of funk, minerals - salt, baking soda - peaches. Light tart and very complex. Medium body, medium carbonation and a tart, floral and fruity aftertaste.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 From notes. Enjoyed at Dougs house for the Epic Peach and Apricot debacle of a tasting that happened on July 9. 750 mL bottle, not sure of the batch. The pour is a hazy orangey golden color with a thick white head that falls to a thin cap. The aroma is full of apricot flesh. There is a lactic funkiness to it and it offers a little wine character. One can definitely tell this is more saison based. The flavor is a little better. There is a lot of chunky apricots, a light yeastiness, a good tartness, and a little funky saison wraps it up. The mouth feel is excellent. Its light and crisp with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly tart apricot and funk on the finish. This is a little disappointing, for what I was expecting, but Id read that coming into it. Bummer. Need to find a Westley now.
Bottle shared by a friend. Hazy orange in color with a medium beige head. Aroma of funk, apricot and big sourness. Malty flavor with apricot flavor before a big sour finish.

Latest batch from generous soul at a share. Cloudy light orange. Nose is ripe and tart apricot flesh, lactic funk. Taste is moderately sour, very mouthwateringly juicy/tart. Flavors of light yogurt, light wheat, and ripe and tart apricots. Great balance.

Pour from a 750 ml bottle at Marks Last Hurrah tasting - thanks again! Pours a hazy pale gold with a small white head that settles into a ring. Notes of lemon, apricot, oak, sour candy - good amount of acidity here. The wine is more subtle, taking a backseat to the more acidic features. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a tart, sharp mouthfeel. Not as complex as Westly, without the same depth of character, but still very good.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Jesus. Aroma is apricot, wine barrel, funky barnyard, sweet and fruity but tart and lovely. Appearance is golden amber, hazy, white head. Taste is tart, dry, apricot, funky, rustic, slight yeast, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, apricot funk aftertaste. Overall, slightly disappointing based on expectations.

Bottle (have had it for about a year). Pours a clear golden with a minimal white head ringing the HF tulip. Mild funk and yeast in the aroma; citrus. I am really not smelling any apricot. Taste is similar. Citrus, funk, fruit, lightly tart. Flavors linger in the finish, and it leaves me salivating (literally). Second glass is hazy, stirred up the yeast a bit... Much more fruit, apricot in the taste. Prefer it. Need to try this one again fresh, for sure. Wonderful.

Small white rim over cloudy yellow beer. Sourish nose, fruity and some delicate hops. Sourish flavour, again delicate fruity acidity. I can believe apricot, if not identify. Light acidburn, light body, fruitfilled. A true discovery, great!

(750ml bottle) cloudy gold, fine white bubbles. Nose of apricots, wine, lacto, tart, complex bug profile. Taste of apricot, wine barrel, lacto, pedio, very tart and lacks some complexity, medium carbonation, long Linger of apricot.

750 ml bottle to snifter. Looks solid; a cloudy golden orange with fizzy eggshell head that dissipates steadily. Smells moderately tart and funky with notes of apricot and mild oak alongside a soft semi-sweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly tart and lactic medium-bodied mouthfeel. Good stuff.

August 5, 2015. Bottle @Sommarprovning, received in a trade with craftbeer1over, thanks!
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, sour and light funky with tart lemon juice, grape skins, sweet juicy apricot and peach pulp, barnyard, hay and minerals. Taste is light sweet, funky and fruity acidic. Finish is slightly dry with grape skin notes, oak, light sweet fruit pulp and sour lemon juice. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation, dry texture. 
Great, lots of juicy and tart fruits.

From 750 ml bottle at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Hazy golden orange color with white to off white head. Yeasty aroma, tart fruity, stone fruits, apricot, peach, funky, wood. Sweet and acidic funky fruity taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Cloudy amber with loads of peach notes in the nose. Some slight lacto, palate is peach dominant but well masked. World class

Bottle at Himmeriget. Pours milky peach with a minute white head. Aroma is lactic, peaches, apricots, slightly grassy/earthy vibes. Taste is yogurt, peaches, apricots, medium sour, medium lactic. Lively body.
750ml bottle thanks to Brian. Pours out a cloudy golden topped with a small head. nose is nice stone fruit apricot funk and barrel. taste is more of the barrel notes funky tart apricot.

750, capped. Thanks for legging out the work to get this one, N! Pours a cloudy medium gold with a loose thinnish white head that lasts. Bright nose, showing fresh apricots and some juicy vinous berries and oak. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Sweet cereal, apricots, and vinous berries on the mid palate. Certainly a wonderful beer, but not remarkable for fruit power or clarity in the flavors--more of a cohesively integrated beer than an explosively flavorful one.
Slightly hazy yellow with a small pale head. Aroma is slightly funky apricots, subtle floral notes. Light-medium bodied, tart on the palate with a fruity background. Taste is apricot, peach skins.

Bottle poured by SARA at Firestone Walkers From the Barrel event. Pours a hazy yellow to light orange with small white head. Aroma is white wine, unripe stone fruit and funk. Taste is moderately sour with some funky orange zest and small amounts of apricot. The fruit wasnt overwhelming but worked well.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours cloudy and yellow with a small, wispy, white head. The aroma offers apricots, a mild measure of funkiness, woodiness, white wine and citric acidity. Full-bodied with a silky mouthfeel and airy carbonation. The flavor is sour and loaded with a medley of fuzzy fruits and citrus fruits, accompanied by yeastiness and a light splash of red wine. Finishes super-fruity and vinous.  Thanks go out to landhoney for sharing this bottle of world-class beer!
Hazy orange color, tiny white head. Sour peach citrus aroma. Flavor is rich with apricot. Fruity up front, very tart finish.

Backlog, August 6, 2015
Wow...! This is an amazing beer in my opinion... I get apricot and some peach candy like flavour. Hint of oak as well. Lovely!

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of tart apricots, light footy funk, vinous notes, and a hint of oak. It pours a hazy dull golden-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a very thin ring. The flavor starts with moderate sweet tart-like apricot. The finish has moderate lemon with some mild funk and a touch of oak. Its light-medium bodied with moderate-lively carbonation.

Un grand merci à Lussier pour cette (brève) dégustation! Ormis le fait que la bière ne présente aucune mousse, le liquide est fort joli. Mon sniffer ressemble vraiment à une grosse pêche! Cest orangé, rosé, serré, dense... réjouissant! Un nez presque sauvage où labricot règne en roi et maître. La levure sauvage est légère ici car cest le fruit qui demande à être au premier plan. Ajoutons à ce bouquet un vieillissement en barrique discret mais structurel et organisé. Une magnifique effervescence en bouche combinée à ce jus dabricot au fort goût de noyaux et vous obtenez un breuvage rafraîchissant et complexe. Le noyau de fruit sexprime ici parfaitement et librement. De la pelure, du soda, une touche boisée, une acidité sûrette mais bien balancée par une bière qui a beaucoup de corps tout en étant légère... Je pourrais boire cette bière à chaque jour!

bottle shared at our big bottle share tasting. poured a deep hazy dark golden orange colour with a stable white head on top. nose of sweet juicy apricots, tart apricots, crisp grains, wet wooden oak, stone fruits, pits, and a weak malt precence. taste of strong deep tart notes upfront, a combo of sour and sweet apricot taste, flesh, more tart and sour upfront instead of fruit, smell is more juicy, lactose sour, pretty full bodied mouthfeel. tasty beer but i was expecting a little bit more of it. cant get any of the pinot noir barrel.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #14 Feat Emma and Aaron! Thanks to Bursprak for bringing this awesome looking bottle!! Pours a hazy orange with a big, fizzy, white head. Aroma has funk, lots of vinous oak, eraser, fruity stone fruits, dry brett. Taste is sour, wheaty sweet, fruits, and then it just fades out. Not as vinous as the aroma.. Still nice, juicy, dry funky and drinkable. High carb.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 3rd place in the sour apricot line up for me. Beat by Casey Fruit Stand and Golden Angel. Pours a lousy pale orange color with a white fine head. Aromas of light peach and slight sour vinegar. Slight hay. Taste is medium sour. Solid apricot sour but not mind glowingly better than the competition.
Poured a hazy straw yellow with a white head. Aroma was perm, manure, and brett. Flavor more on the cheesy non perm dide. Pretty SD our. Meh.
Bottle shared thanks to Art. Poured cloudy orange white head. Aroma salty hotdog water apricot. Light carb med bod. Taste quite sour salivary gland pumping
Poopy peaches herbs and minerals. Hazy orange white head. Nice looking beer. Tart sour tangy peaches some sulfur hay not much else. Lingering tart tang.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares 14. Pours hazy orange with a small fizzy white head. Aromas of stone fruits, brett, lactic tart, vinous funk, oaky. Taste has lots of stone fruits, dry vinous notes, pretty tart, bretty, juicy but very shortlasting, dry as fokkkk. Also has a slight grainy note to it.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 14 feat. Emma & Aaron. Side by side with Fou 15. Hazy yellowish pour with a light orange head. Nose has dried apricots, peaches and some funk. Taste is doughy, vinous, peaches, apricots, dried fruits with a dry and short finish.
750ml bottle of batch 10. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Medium sourness and abundant fruit. Good balance of the sour and fruit.
23 oct 2025, bottle. Hazy light yellow. Nose is tart, funky, apricot. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Some smarties candy, moderately tart, mildly sweet. Nice.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2015 Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare 14. Thanks Bursprak for bringing this. My #100 Sour/Wild Ale. Thanks to Bursprak! Pours unclear orange with a tiny head. Aroma of apricots, some lactic tartness, lots of stone fruits in general, brett, sugary apricots, oak and a nice mellow balance in general. Smells good! The taste has some apricot, some wood, weak dry champagne, pretty tart and bretty and a shot lasting juicy feel as well. Short duration in general but this is classy delicate and enjoyable indeed!

Bottle shared. Pours very hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of tart fresh apricot, wood, light funk, lacto and light vinous notes. Flavour is moderate acidic. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.
Bottle at tasting at home. Hazy golden beer with an offwhite head. Sourish fruity citrus aroma. Sourish fruity grassy woody rubber earthy funky flavour. Nice Lovely one :-)
Sour smell with peach. Taste is the same. Sourness is light to medium. Medium body, medium carbonation, and some creamy foam.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy opaque golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of apricots, oak, and light funk. Flavour brings out fresh apricots that dominate along with lots of lacto - low acidity, low funk and a touch of wood, but not getting the red wine. Super apricoty, with the acidity and funk slightly coming through at the end. Excellent beer.

(Bottle) Pours hazy gold with a small head. The aroma holds funk, peach and tight malt. Really compact . The flavour is dry, light bitter and near heavily acidic with funk, peach and slim malt. The mouthfeel is tart with medium carbonation. Light to medium carbonation.

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Cloudy yellow/golden beer with a decent off white head. Sourish fruity rubber aroma, apricot, vinous, funky, citrus, grapefruit, woody, some hay. Sourish apricot flavor, grassy, hay, floral, woody, rubber, funky, citrus, earthy notes, sweetish and sour at the same time, dandelions, grassy, herbal, some grapefruit. Excellent sour.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange amber. Aroma is funky fruity peach sour citric. Flavor is tart citric fruity peach vinous acidic, very clean.

Bottle courtesy of hackobock. Pours very hazy pale yellow with a fizzy white head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and funky with crackers, lemon juice, apricots, peaches, hay, dry soil, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is slightly sour, fruity and funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, lemon juice, apricots, peaches, hay, dry soil, barnyard, minerals, grape skins and lemon zest. Just great! Huge apricot and peach mixed with balanced pleasant tartness and great funkiness. Excellent!

Inviting aroma of lemon, peach, yoghurt, big apricot, very fruity and a nice stonefruity oak twang to it. Taste is lots of apricot, minor funk with a good hay juiciness to it. Great mouthfeel, gueuze like carbonation.

This was batch eight according to the bottle and is a very nice pit-fruit sour/saison/whatever on par w/ Side Project Fuzzy and some other things that seem a bit more hyped up around these parts. Its very cloudy and light orange in color w/ a tight-bubbled white head. It has a mild nose w/ lots of warm spice and fruit. Tasted, this is a crisply tart beer, very mildly sweet and nicely fruity. This is a medium bodied brew w/ prickly carbonation and a touch of apple skin tannin in the finish. Definitely, this is a very nice beer.

Bottle: Cloudy, bright sunburst orange body; very juicy, dense, & basically opaque. Foamy white head settles to a collar quickly. Smells like an apricot basket at the farmers market covered in ten-year old musty-ass cobwebs. Goddamn! So fresh & inviting on the nose with a huge bit of funk, driftwood, oak, lemon, peach, & tons of apricot. Flavor is even more juicy. Bursting with apricot all over the place. Nice lactic underbody with a mild vanilla yogurt & mineral water finish. Hints of lemon, peach, musty barnyard hay, & damp grass flutter throughout. Finishes clean & dry with mouthfuls of juicy apricot goodness. Wheelhouse beer for me. This was fantastic on all levels.

Bottle courtesy of Stephen and shared with the Shape crew. 
Orangée trouble, col fin blanc.
Arôme au bouquet suret mais au rétro offrant de belles effluves dabricot fermenté presque de confiture.
Palais offre un très bon caractère de labricot sans tomber dans un style sour qui fait de lexcès. Retrouve un profil suret sur un léger boisé mais bien ponctué par les notes dabricot. Léger en épicé venant probablement du chêne, fini râpeux avec une note plus présente du Pinot Noir. Après on peut discuter du mérite dune touche saison qui reste cependant assez discrète.
Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is lots of funk, apricots, stone fruits, juicy. Taste is light bodied, good fruit, easy drinking. Overall, a nice beer.
Bottle - Funky creamy lacto and stone fruit. Cloudy gold with a white head. Lacto, funky cheese and apricot. Light tart and balanced. Nice.
750ml bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow color with a smaller sized head. Apricots, peaches, funky, some vinous notes, and citrus.

B7 Bottle : Pour is modest, white, with average retention in this glass - It pours hazy light golden. The nose is grassy, lactic, stone fruit presence, with feint barrel presence - Its nice. Its also generally subdued. Then again, I just had a La Fosse. The Saison label (barrel aged with apricot) is far more relevant than the sour category in my world. Either way : It begins subdued, once again - mineral water moves to sweeping grass, which moves to a kiss of wine barrel presence. Stone fruit rounds out the back end, and again, its light. Truly a wonderful drinker and near perfect balance - but I would never go out of my way for this one again.

A huge thanks to yourefragile for sharing.

Hazy, straw yellow body with some yeast evident. Small, broken head. Lovely aroma of lactic funk and citrus. Orange, apricot, melon, assorted stone fruit with tropical notes as well. Juicy and delicious. Gently tart balanced my a natural fruity sweetness. Notes of pineapple, guava. Light in body and dangerously drinkable. Fabulous.
Bottle, Apricot juice sweetness. Just a touch of sour. Apricot pit finish. Opened this after a de garde imperial apricot bu, and this didnt come close. Not bad, but way overhyped.

75cl bottle. Hazy gold pour with plenty of white lacing. Aroma is full of apricot, barrel, peach, barnyard must, some dry citrus. Taste is all about the apricot, with plenty of juicy sweet peach and light orange too, good musty barnyard notes, barrel, dry citrus, wheaty note. Medium body. Acidity rises in the finish, with good citrus and funk. Apricot lingers, as does the barrel character. So bright, juicy, tangy - fabulous.

[2/13/15] Draught at Sante Adairius Rustic Ales in Capitola. Cloudy orange. Lovely aroma, funky, full of juicy fruits. Wonderful sour flavor, intensely fruity, funky, with a bit of sweat and some lacto. Medium-bodied, rounded mouthfeel. Wonderful stuff, really delicious.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2015 Update (04/28/15): shared a bottle of batch 2. Very different. Mineraly nose, fruity but not strongly apricot. Flavor is much more tart than a new bottle and overtly funky. Again, fruity but not clearly apricot like a new bottle. Good bite. 

(March 2015) Finally get to try a bottle! Cloudy golden orange. Great apricot aroma, farmhouse. Dry, woody, apricot, grass. Tingly mouthfeel. Sourdough finish.

Bottle, not sure which batch but I believe this was bottled last fall. Pours a glowing, hazy orangey gold with one finger of dense off-white head. Very pretty. Aroma is amazing: musky apricots and peaches leap out of the glass, along with white grape, Chardonnay, lychees, brine, buttery sweet roll, SweeTarts, soft funk, and oak barrel. Taste is tart and juicy apricots, dried apricot, and yellow plum fading into sour muscat grapes and complex wine-like and oaky notes. A true standout is the texture: creamy and juicy with delicate, elegant carbonation that still manages to be lively. Sour but not overly so. Not funky enough to bring to mind lambic but near the pinnacle of fruited American wild ales.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a decent white head. Aroma of fruit, funk, grass, and wood. Taste is peach, apricot, funk, grass, and oak. Superb!

Bottle to glass. Pours a beautiful white peachy color with a thin fizzy off white head. Aroma is a huge dry tart apricots. Flavor is sharply sour and citrusy that quickly turns into a squeezed apricots. Nice lingering sour. Excellent. Thanks JP for sharing!

Draft at SARA. Pours a hazy gold with a bit of carb on the edges. Apricots, barrel and funk up front on the nose. Moderately tart with wine-like complexity and a long apricot finish. Lively and prickly on the palate.

Bottle shared by my buddy Taylor M. This is a really nice apricot sour. Lots of apricot and peach fruit aromatics and flavor to balance the acidity. Barrel is well integrated and does not overshadow the beer in any way. Liked this more than some other similar bears because of the balance.

Was just giddy to try this one. My name, my sisters name, barrel aged saison with fruit, hype. Yes and yes. Peach, apricot, juicy, nicely dry, delicate, not very complex. Just a really great beer that I honestly could drink all day. The wine added just a touch of extra fruitiness. Lovely.
Bottle. Orange pour. Nice sweet apricot aroma with hints of orange and lacto tartness. Tastes like an apricot sweettart with a full fruit flavor melding into a solid tart body. Really nicely done.
Bottle with the crew. Lots of fruit on the aroma. Light tartness and lots of fruit again in the flavor. Murky yellow color. Really light and refreshing. Bit of grassiness on the finish. Lemon.

Tasted at the 8th Annual Bistro Barrel Aged Beer Fest on Nov 9, 2013. This wild ale pours a cloudy yellow gold color from a 750ml bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, apricot and funky. A medium bodied wild ale. The malts are fruity, tart and sweet. The hops are earthy. Tart and fruity, funky and sweet. The tartness builds as you go. Nice apricots flavors, not too sweet. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly tart.
750 bottle big thanks to John for sharing. Sour lemon funk with that touch of apricot. Semi dry. Really really good.

Golden Orange pour with a nice but small frothy white head. Superb apricot scent with lactic notes. Light crispy body, super fresh lactic fruity flavors, delicate apricot notes. Fantastic sour finish, very well balanced. Super stuff.

Bottle shared at Kernel, cheers MannyGoldberg. Hazy pale straw with small white head. Fresh peach and apricot aroma, light and zesty. Spritzy carb. Flavour of tart stone fruit, grape skin, lime and soda, apricot and unripe nectarine. Top notch.

Bottle from chebyshev, think batch 2, shared for the joint 12K tasting. Hazy yellow, Brett and some oak, peaches, epsom salts, light pepper, horse blanket and a bit of tannin, moderate carbonation and body, becomes quite dry with a nice finish although lacks the depth I was expecting.

Murky golden-peach colored body, thin white head, and sparse lacing. Apricot, lactic wheat, light lemon, peach, and wheat. Medium bodied with soft carbonation, moderate acidity, and a touch of sweetness, giving this an orange juice like feel.

P: Hazy yellow with a thin white head. S: Very funky beer, Apricots, wines, socks, oak and lemons. T: Juicy apricots, some yogurt tartness and a bit of lacto in the back. M: Thin with soft carbonation and a decent amount of tartness. O: I like the juicy apricots on this one, and its no doubt a delicious beer but I wanted more out of this one.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is grassy, taste is funky, barnyard, lemon, awesome

Bottle: Poured a straw color ale with a nice foamy head with OK retention. Aroma of sour and tart notes with some light funky yeast notes is quite nice. Taste is a great mix between some sour and tart notes with some funky yeast. Apricot notes a very subtle and kind of hard to distinguish. Pinot noir barrel lend a light vinous feel to the beer. Body is quite full with good carbonation. Enjoyable sour but I would have preferred more apricot notes to be upfront.

This was really nice. Pours slightly clear limited head and no lacing. Nose is tart, some peach some yeast. Flavours are tart, some peach, some dough. Light body with a very dry finish. Tastes medium tart and light sweet. Foufoun-ish!

A hazed golden ale with a thin head. In aroma, loads of Brett, ground cherries, lactic acid, Epsom the, wet soil, very nice. In mouth, a nice lactic acid, puckering quality, Epsom salts, peaches, beautiful. Merci guys...

Bottle. Very acidic yet lovely nose with aromas of fresh apricot, moderate lactobacillus funk, some wet horse blanket, notes of vanilla and light oak. Pours a semi-cloudy light lemon color. Light, tart taste with mild stone-fruit flavors and sweet orange with a very dry acidic finish. Pretty darn nice.

750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of rich tart apricot notes, white bread and oak. Flavour of rich tart apricot, lactic acid, lemon, pinot noir, wood and honey-like sweetness. Some minerals as well. Medium bodied and high carbonation. Like a berliner weisse really.

75 cl bottle.
Pours cloudy yellow color with no head. Rowan berries and apricot on the nose, yeast and some rose hip also. Rose hip, apricot, yeast, grassy notes, nettle and grapefruits on the flavor, some vinous notes too, lots of citrus too. Nice sour palate. A bit stuffy though.
3455

75 cl bottle @ tiong
Aroma has lactic acid, grapefruit and some earthy tones. Also sour cream. Flavour is tart with green apples, sour cream and lactic tones. Also some vinegar-like sourness and acidic white wine. Apricots are barely noticeable behind the sourness. Imperial berliner weisse.

750ml bottle from Summer Secret Santa 2014, huge thanks to ineedbeer!

Pours yellowish orange with a small head. Aroma of tart apricot, vinous notes, wood, spices, sourness and lactic notes. Taste is tartish with loads of apricot, ripe fruits, berries, slight sourness, some lactic notes, funky yeast and wood, hints of vinegar. Finish is tart, sour and heavy with apricot notes, wood and vinous notes, hints of vinegar. Pretty nice, vinegary and lactic sour ale with loads of apricot.

Thnx to brystmar 
Pours unclear orange no real head . 
Smell is appricot , fresh , sour . 
Taste is sharp sour , candy like apricot , fleshy , dusty most ( peach-powder ) , bit sweet in the back , yet very sour . Full taste , perfect carbo . Pretty goddamn tasty !
Bottle at goulét brewery bus tour. Hazy golden pour with white head. Apricots, funk and other tart fruit aromas. Brett, apricots, tartness, and other sour flavors. Very smooth.
Shared by a good friend. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is sour apricots. Taste is tart and sour fruity goodness. Love this apricot sour!! Awesome!

750ml bottle pours hazy pale orange with a finger of head, tons of fruit sludge in bottle, left out of pour. Nose is tart musty juicy apricot, toasted bread, dry oak, light funk, citrus. Taste is bright acidic apricot, dusty oak funk, touch of grain and white bread, wood, lacto. Finish is sour acidic apricot and marmalade, orange zest, dusty attic wood. Became more acidic as it warmed and while still delicious, was very sour by the end of the glass.
Pours a hazy gold with no head. Aroma of apricots, sour wheat and funk. Taste is apricots, sour wheat. This is big apricot flavor. Really solid fruited sour!

The look of this beer is quite nice, the cloudy orange. It has a nice fizz. But something about its acidity, reminds me of bile. I was quite disappointed. It could be the bottle I received. I am willing to give this one another go. But first round, I was not impressed.
750ml bottle. Nice dryness and tannic barrel notes, fruity peaches, good saison.

Bottle @ What the Funk Denver 2014. Pours a cloudy orange appearance with a white head. Super juicy peach / apricot aroma with some funk. A bit of wood and spritz as well. Dry and yet very quenching flavor. Full of fruit (apricot / peach / pear). Definitely get some dryness on the back end with some vinous notes. Moderately sour. Really a fun beer though it wasnt crazy complex. Glad to finally have tried this.
Great balance in this beer. the fruit, funk, acid & barrel character are all in harmony. Fresh apricot & peach aroma& flavor, not overly sour. A pleasure to drink.
750ml, very nice, cloudy blonde orange pour. light funk, peaches, apricot, passion fruit notes. more tart than sour. nice

Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy orange with smalll white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is peaches, apricot, oak, and yeast. Medium mouthfeel with strong peach, light acidity, funk, and nice tart finish. Wow really enjoyed this one.
Initial whiff of apricot with underlying acidity and some mild funk. Wine barrel plays in well. One of my first bottles from SARA and it did not disappoint.
Hazy orange/golden pour, white head. Nice lacing. Nose is apricots, some vinous notes. Taste is fresh apricots, tart, wine barrels. Light smooth palate.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2014 Pour is a lightly hazed golden amber with a white head. Nose is lambic esq. Has some  dusty cellar brett, and nice notes of nectarine and peach. Taste is less lambic and more fruity. Not sour. Moderate carbonation and a creamy body. Bright peach, nectarine and some grapefruit. There is some dusty brett, gentle acidity, a bit sweet in the flavor.
Bottle. Dried apricots right up front with some lactic sour and a strawberry and earthy funk in the dry finish. Very tart and fresh apricot taste.

75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, with apricots, thx to John for bringing this over!, complex sour fruit brew, fruity/sour and slightly woody/vinous, very balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

750 ML bottle
Thanks to Owen for opening this. 

Hazy orange color, persistent half finger of white head. 
Lactic sourness, very perky carbonation, stone fruit, ripe peaches, slight dryness and easily crushable. Excellent, excellent beer

In short: A dry & funky farmhouse fruity blonde ale with moderate sweetness. Excellent.
How: From a bottle at Hill Farmstead FoFA 2013.
The look: Cloudy peach color body topped by a persistent small white head.
In long: Nose has a nice horsy farmhouse character along with light color fruits (not particularly apricots). Smooth mouthfeel with a medium body, a soft texture and a relaxed carbonation. Taste has sharp. A medium fruit presence (peaches, apricots, grapefruits flesh), a medium acidity/sourness level, an appreciable dryness, nice farmhouse funk, cheese, horse blanket, woody white wine. Less apricots-forward than I expected, I could have believed it is made with peaches and other fruits. I really liked this beer. A great beer I got to try at Hill Farmstead FoFA 2013, tickets for that festival were expensive but lucky for me I found money in the pockets of an old jacket, not sure if I can call it luck since it wasnt my jacket and someone was wearing it.

Bottle. Hazy orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of peaches, lemon, apple skin, flowers, wood and light barnyard. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of peaches, apples and lemon. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really, really good. Fruity and dry.
Light orange color, white head. Unripe stone fruit, peaches, apricots, yeast,lactic sourness. Very damn good!

Pours a hazy orange with a small, quickly diminishing white head. Aromas of lemon, tangerine and stone fruits. The brett is hiding in this one, but about to come out. Flavors are wonderfully sour and complex. Dry and very delicate on the tongue. Amazing beer! Thanks for sharing Aaron.

This is not the most recent batch. Pour is a beautiful golden orange. Nose is very nice, quite funky with far my, lambic like qualities, some peach skin coming through. Less peach than I expected, more wild, farm notes. Flavor is straight on acidic, very sour, fruit is distant. Deep finish is all tart, jaw sour feelings. Some dry mineral notes. This could be a good beer when fresh, but a year or whatever this is at is too much.
9th December 2013Tasting at Bruces pad. Hazy bright orange beer. Small white head. Palate is light and crisp. Seltzer zingy salts. Tart fresh orange, little lemon. Light crispy finish. Pretty tasty.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, big thanks to our host, 09/12/13.
Hazed orange with a thin off white head.
Nose is tarte citrics, light smoke, burnt peach skins, orange peel, musty, light acid.
Taste comprises orange pith, bitter apricot, tarte peach, light smoke, touch of dry rot, mandarin, light balsams.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry crisp finale.
Solid sour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle, big thanks to Bruce. It pours hazy pale orange with a small white head. The nose is earth, wood, vanilla, sweet orange, apricot, peach, dankness, barnyard, light vinegar and a touch of sulphur in the background. The taste is quite tart upfront, tart peach, apricot, good deal of acidity, touch of creaminess, sherbet, faint vinegar, lemon and sour candy with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Nice perky tartness. Really rather delicious.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 Bottle cheers to the hostess with the mostess, Bruce. Pours a very bright and in your face orange with a small white head leaving great lacing. Nose is very tangy lemon and lime, mild spice, very pepper forward, big mandarin, sherbert and plenty of bretty notes. Very zesty. Taste is super juicy citric sweetness, tangy lemon juice and lime peel. Spice is mild and works well. Some vinous notes mingle with big tropical fruits - apricot, mandarin, mango and nectarine. Great balance between sour and sweet. Fantastic stuff

Bottle shared at Bruces in London - big thanks to the Boss. Pours hazy, yellow-orange with a creamy white head. Lovely citric aroma, plenty of mandarin orange, tangerine. Light sweet flavor, good and tangy, loads of citrus fruits, perhaps some really ripe and juicy apricot. Light to medium bodied with average to lively carbonation. Juicy and somewhat thick citrus fruits to finish, fleshy apricot, moderate acidic lemon burn. Quite drinkable though does have a bit of kick. Really nice.

Bottle shared at Daks Black Friday event...props to whomever brought it! Muddled golden tangerine pour with a small eggshell crown that left delicate lacing inside the glass. Juicy ripe and tart green apricot in the nose along with a mild funk, earthiness, grassiness, and a subtle lactic quality. Flavor shows fuzzy peach, yeast, puckering lemon, sour citrus, and a hint of cheese.  Got some wine-like qualities but not a ton of wood from the barrel.  Really complex and delicious...want more!

Moving my old review over here.

Bottle pour at the Hill Farmstead Festival of Farmhouse Ales.


A - Pours a hazy sun kist peach color with a nice one and a half finger tall white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving small streaks of lace on the sides of the glass.


S - Smells of juicy apricots, woody oak, mild funk, white wine, bit of lactic sourness, some must and a bit of sweet pale malt. Love the funky apricot.


T - Starts off with the ripe apricots slowly giving way to some mild musty funk, white wine, oak, yogurt and a bit of sweetness from the base malt. Finish is pretty dry, lingering long after the finish. Really awesome flavors working together make this one super easconsume.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Smooth, sticky fruit feel with a nice dry ending. Really awesome flavors working together make this one super easy to consume.


O - Loved this one. We drank a bunch of other Peach and Stone Fruit sours the night before and I would say this was my favorite of the bunch. I would love to get my hands on a couple bottles of this one.

Bottle shared by Tooch4321...thanks Adam! - Pours hazy golden with a thin bubbly head. Nose is pungent apricot, sour, tart yogurt, and a gentle vinegar tartness. Taste is real gentle peach, yogurt, medium tartness--so smooth. Gentle and fluffy body.

Bottle from release. Aroma and flavor a nice mix of Anais, apricots and Pinot barrel. Had a light-medium sour tartness, lighter carbonation, and a kick-ass yeast profile. I've found that the common yeast strain in most of the SARA beers set them apart from others; that's the edge for me. Excellent beer.

Bottle. Hazy amber beer with a cream head. Tart and light yeast aroma. Lemony tart flavor with light sourness and light yeast. Medium bodied. Lemon and tartnes lingers with light sour notes, light oak, and light yeast.

Batch 4 750mL bottle.
Aroma is fairly fruit forward with a lot of apricots. Light acidity and faint barnyard funk. A hint of a sulfur and medium light oak notes.
Pours a very murky golden yellow with a thin white head that recedes quickly to the edges. Light lacing and faint legs.
Flavor has moderate acidity with a nice moderately strong fruitiness. Light funkiness with a complimentary oak character. Light sweetness. Lingering acidity and fruit character.
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium light carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth.
Overall a super enjoyable fruity farmhouse beer. Tons of apricot character with nice light oak and complimentary yeast character. Very easy drinking beer for all occasions.
god damned gorgeous. unripe, tart, lactic, clean, complex, simple. everything that the chocolate peanut butter imperial stout aged in Bourbon Maple-Syrup barrel lovers dont get. just what I love!
On tap at ratebeer Gallery event. Poured yellow dirt with funk aroma. Taste was acidic with a slight dry tart finish
Pours dishwater gold with a creamy white head. Sort of wet sweat sox aroma with some light stone fruit. Med body. Slightly sour citrus/grapey/light stone fruit flavors. Finishes delicious.

Smell of apricots. Clean Sour. Golden color. Can taste Pinot barrel. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong apricot. Finish with saison. Slightly funky. Slight old socks on the nose

Hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of dirty socks, funk, dried apricots... Flavor is actually quite pleasant, sweetness of apricots, but dryness from Saison yeast and earthiness still prevalent... Notes of grapes, red wine... Solid 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes on 8/11/2013; poured from bottles by the SARA crew at the HF FoFA. 

Plenty of white head and lace. Great aroma of freshly picked apricots and oak accented by bright yeast. Juicy, delicate fruit balances atop the soured base. Pinot character is mild enough not to get in the way, yet forward enough to add complexity. Puckering, yet balanced; bold, yet refined. Fantastic.

Hype is power. Above all this is a funky sour. Taste is a very light dried apricot not fresh apricot. Almost unnoticeable because the sourness masks it. Mostly lemon and grapefruit. Drying lactic tones. Light oak. Slight bitter. Low carbonation and no head. Nice sour but its not blowing me away. I love the funk in the aroma. Funk & Sour!

Ive heard a lot about this beer before having it. It had a lot to live up to.

Its aroma wasnt particular unique, not of putting at all, but a little more funky than I expected and not something that prepared me for the torrent of glorious apricot tartness to come.

The beer is gorgeous. The color was a perfect opaque pale orange. The head was a bit smaller than anticipated, I almost thought it may be under carbonated. Turns out I just cant pour a beer correctly.

The taste was everything I wanted it to be. A perfect apricot sour. I shared this with a friend of mine who is a little too obsessed with Fou Foune. He said this was just as good, far better than he wanted it to be.

I dont even have notes about the mouth feel as it was exactly what it should be.

West Ashley exceeded my expectations. Its a phenomenal beer. SARA is the real deal.

Aroma: Hay, Lactic Acid, Funky

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Minimal Head, No Lacing

Taste: Apricot, Hay, Lactic Acid

Mouthfeel: Mediocre Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Tart, Mildly Drying

pours hazy pale yellow with a nice white cap, good retention and nice lacing. apricot stones, cheesy lactic, other fruits, sherbet-like, spices, citric acid notes too. average to moderate carbonation, light body - oily, slightly puckering and fruity herbal finish. saison and pinot noir character a bit diluted in this citric concotion. still.. nice and unique but not outstanding.

Bottle. Light haze, gold pour. Aroma of apricots, quite citric, very lemony, light acetic notes as well, cheesy. Tart, soured fruits, not very apricot forward at all, some slightly unpleasant almost gastric notes. Palate is very dry, no residual sugars at all. Carbonation is very light as well, which seems to contribute to the puckering. Not bad, but not up to the saisons (sours).

Pours a light yellow with no head and thus no lacing. Aroma is sharply sour but also fruity with a nice "fresh apricots" feel. Taste is really tart, maybe too much even. I couldnt really taste anything else than the acid but I would venture to say that it was fruity on the back end. Body is light, carbonation level high. Overall a nice fruity saison that ends up being a touch too sour and a bit hard to drink. Quite pleased to have had the opportunity to sample this, though.

Bottle (750 ml). Hazy yellow with a small white head and light lacing. Aroma is of apricots, peaches, light red wine notes, yeast and herbal presence. Taste is slightly sweet with apricots and peaches, light red wine, yogurt, good sourness, oak, herbal notes and light wine. Light/medium body. Moderate carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Slightly dry finish. Good fruity sour, but not as complex as I was expecting. Maybe my expectations were a tad too high for this one. It was really good and fruity, but the fruits arent as bright and juicy as I thought they would be.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours blond with very low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of apricots, sugar, wine, acid? Taste is of apricots, sourness, wine, acid, sourness. Palate: Light body. Overall: Good. Very sour (too much for me). Winy.

Bottle at FoFA 13. Pretty, cloudy peach pour with fluffy white head. Nose and flavor hold gorgeous lactic tang, tart apricot, oak, light white wine. Just a beautiful sour. Not Fou Foune, nor should it be, and damn is this an awesome American representation of a stonefruit sour. Superb.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 Bottle at Armins with friends. Pour is hazy orange with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Big fruity, peachy, apricot, lightly funky, biscuity, yeasty, sour grainy, and floral aroma. Taste is sour peach, apricots, lightly spicy, sweet fruit, doughy, tart fruits, biscuit, and yeast with a fresh fruity sour finish. Light body with medium carbobation. Such a delicious and easy drinking sour. This is an excellent representation of what peach sours should be.

750 at Armin's. Fuck yeah! Thank you Steve_0! Aroma is huge sour peach, apricot, amazing smooth delicious fruit. Taste is delicious awesome medium acidic sour peach, apricot, beautiful tart fruit notes. Amazing beer! Very similar to Fou Foune. Awesome

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, big thanks to Stephen. Pour is hazy orange pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of big peach, vinegar, vanilla, hints of oak, slight earth, nice peach, apricot notes. Taste is a mix of big peach, nice earth, hints of oak, nice vanilla, lemon, finishing fairly bitter, slightly lemony nice peach. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Sampled at FoFA 2013. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of apricots, sourness, some wine and oak, and light malts. Flavor an incredible blend of everything. Average texture for the style. A really good beer.
Edit: 750ml bottle (latest batch as of 1/2/14) in a tulip.  Same appearance. Aroma strong of sourness and apricots.  Flavor the same as before.  A really great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Batch #2 bottled January 2013. Apricots, apricots, apricots! Wonderful tartness, without removing my teeth enamel. Balanced, mildly toasty barrel nuances intermingle with fruit. Just a great beer.. No need to over analyze it. --- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Bottle shared at Dans Birthday Tasting (Lyons, IL). Pours a well hazed golden amber hue, gentle orange glow. Well hazed, decent frothy whitish head atop stays as a mellow film, laces as a decent ring atop. Aromas are tart and lactic, some firm peach elements wander in with firm lemony lactic life. As it settles, the sour edge really gives a good feel. Bigger peach, apricot, lemon, yogurt. Really nice. Some gentle bread, really rich sour fruit nose. Initial firmly sour, big peach and lemon, nice big fruit presence. Nothing harsh with some good lemony lactic vibe, good sourness, some yogurt is big. Touches of oak, gentle vanilla, firmly sour without any hint of acidity in the slightest. Quite lovely. Middle is fruity, sour, lactic. Bigger peach element into the middle. The backend is dry, lactic and lovely. Wow. Really offers a perfect layer of consistency here. Nothing harsh but still firmly sour, still a big fruit presence while the lactic edge really sets the pace. Tasty shit right here. Gentle bretty quality, but really this is all fruit and lactic sourness. I wouldnt call it complex, but it is very well made. Well done.

Pours a cloudy yellow straw color with a finger of white bubbles. Nose is funky apricot, wet wood, dusty brett, vinous booze. The palate follows the nose with bright yogurt like acidity, round mellow apricot, grainy, citrus pith, traces of vinous tannins and musk.

Bottle, thanks to GT, 08/20/2013. Batch 3 probably. Hazy orange pour, white hazy head rests on the surface, thin ring of lacing. Aroma is rich fleshy apricot, lactic sourness, orange essence, earthy wood finish. Taste is fruity, tangerine, juice peach and other stone fruit, soft creamy lactic notes, lingering tartness. Medium body, bright feel. Really nice.
Poured an apricot orange, no head but very pulpy. Smell of stone fruit and brett. Very tasty full of peach, mild brett, peach pulp, light sourness and ver. Juicy. Still pprefer bright sea blonde

Bottle shared at Amarin. Pours cloudy grapefruit. White head. Nose and taste of fresh apricot, french oak, light sour wheat, pureed apricot and wild yeast. Some pulp. Touch if Parmesan in nose. Medium body.

Had this at the FoFA. Pours a golden straw color with nice fizzy white head. Aroma is huge apricots and oak and wine. Taste is juicy apricots, yogurt tartness, spicy oak, and perfect finish. Favorite new rate of the festival.

Hazy golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of apricots, citrus, brett, wood, spices, wild yeast, and pinot. Taste of apricots, some wood, wild yeast, light pinot, vanilla, and a tart finish.
bottle offered at farmhouse ale fest. boost well hidden. juicy fresh apricot. great apricot character. fresh peaches. cream. pleasant yogurt sourness. awesome balance. yum a dum dum.
sample at HF Saison fest, yea this one is it, WOW, blown away, fantastic beer with huge apricot flavors, I really wanna try what else these guys can do!

Bottle thanks 50belair - pours a hazy yellow w/ frothy white head. Oranges, tangerines, and some floral notes in the aroma. Oranges, tangerines, lemons, and a little acidic in the end but really well balanced. This is beer is solid!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Cloudy orangish yellow pour. Enticing sour apricot aromas. Sour apricots, Pinot Noir, oak, and yeast notes. Great mouthfeel and balance. Good body. Sour and refreshing, but not overly tart or acidic.

750mL shared at the Bruery Reserve Society tasting. Full haze glowing straw to white peach color with minimal white foam. Nose is incredible juicy apricot, dried apricot, peach fuzz and fresh juice squeeze. Taste massive apricot with fresh and fuzzy skins, juicy and rich, huge lactic/yogurt back end. Key lime and salt lime buoyancy. Delicious.

Bottle with Keith and Alan acquired via trade. Pours hazy gold with tiny white lacing. Dry peach, apricot, mandarin orange, vino barrels and other dry fruit. Lots of watery sourness and earthy lactic acid. Puckery tart finish. Amazing sour ale that may be better than fantasia?

Bottle. Colour...cloudy-straw with little head. Nose...geez Louise this is funky! Im not liking the aroma so I hope the palate is better. Palate...ah! Theres the apricot, in spades! And quite a bit of tanginess! A bit of dry earth, lots of lemon juice and plenty of underripe cots and cot skins. Dandy stuff!

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 [ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Tulip ][ 9.27.14 ]Murky peach pour, puffy white head laces all over, drops to oily cap. Lightly burnt peach notes, musky rype-rotting borderline, bit nutty and vegetal. Brighter flavor, grilled peach with tons of acid at the front,light vanilla sweetness early before a harsh, grapefruit-bitter mid with heavy skin, lightly fizzy with moderate bitterness, stinky flesh through the end, bit dry and papery. No sweetness, too much bitterness, and too much acid.  [ 9.27 Tasting Ranking ]  01. Block 15 Turbulent Peche 02. Sante Adairius Westly 03. Jester King Fen Tao 04. Block 15 Golden Canary 05. Block 15 Petit Verdot 06. Sante Adairius West Ashley  07. De Garde Imperial Hop Bu 08. Side Project Fuzzy09. De Garde Peach Bu 10. Forest and Main Marius Plum 11. New Glarus R & D Wild Peach 12. Lost Abbey Veritas 13 13. Captain Lawrence Flaming Fury (b2) 14. OEC Experimentalis w Peaches (Zinfandel)15. Wicked Weed Genesis  16. Perennial Berliner 17. Almanac Farmers Reserve Pluot 18. Plan Bee Precious 19. Round Guys The Berliner 20. Forest and Main Marius Peach 21. Plan Bee CombCourtesy of dirt. murky tangerine orange, large bubbled white head thats gone fast. Meaty manure nose, light apricot with warmth. Pleasant flavor, heavy lactic acid, light orange and apricot, awesome fruit balance through the sour end, incredibly reminiscent of young foufone. Short, dry finish, lightest burn but very well rounded.

750ml bottle. Thanks to Sean for sharing... Pours slightly hazy pale sunny orange and topped with a thin film of soapy white head... White wine and citrus, pithy orange. Mimosa-esque. Very refreshing with a decent degree of tartness... Flavors sour white wine, prickly pear, and citrus notes. A slight grain backing coming through late. Lighter bodied and drinks real easy. Would seek out more of this.

750 ml. bottle. It pours a nice orange color with a white head. The aroma is super clean, tart and peachy. Mouthwatering. Very little brett, but it lets you know its there. The flavor is very quenching with a nice tart fruit character apricots, peaches, very mild leather and super subtle pinot barrel notes that you really have to think hard about to find. Slightly vinous. Overall, this is a firmly tart wild beer with a lot of subtleties. Very well balanced. If I have one complaint its in the mouthfeel. It is a bit on the light and weak side for a 7.3% beer, but Im probably splitting hairs. Great new sour. Love these guys.
Bottle. Pours opaque yellow amber with chunks. Small white head, great lacing. Aroma is apricot, tart, funk, fruity lemon. Flavor is very fruity and lightly tart, very nice.
bottle from a friend. lovely peach nose, crisp and tart, vinuous, fresh and a pickled sort of taste. horsey funk and extremely dry finish. Realy a special beer and one that I could drink daily.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 On tap at SARAs 1st anniversary party. A - - pours hazy glowing straw/orange. With low white head. Some lacing. S - deceivingly simplistic sour aromas up front. light vinegar and lemon and orange zest and juice notes. these give way to nice bretty aromas, with funk and hay. The end is a really Nice quiet apricot and peach. M - tart light body. Smooth and drinkable with a zing up front and a slightly thicker palate. Lingering sweet dry end. T - at first it seems to be a simple citrusy sour. Lemon and tart orange. Notes of the zest and fresh juice. this slowly morphs to a lightly funky thicker feeling malty body. Fantastic fresh and dried apricot and peaches. also some grapefruit juice on the palate. Lingering tart yet sweet drier ending. O - a great subtle and very tasty sour. Apricots and awesomeness

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 Bottle, Batch 2. Pours a hazy light golden color with a very thin layer of bubbles forming a white head. Acidic aroma filled with lemon peel, peach skins, apricot skins, nice brett funk that plays into the fruit very nicely. Some spicy Belgian yeast aromas in there as well, but a little masked by the brett barnyard funk. Very nice. First few sips are rather puckering, unlocking a lot of that apricot tartness and some vanilla. The beer dances on the tongue with great medium carbonation. Next few sips I really started to pick up on a vinous oaky flavor that most of Santes sours have. Finish is tart, woody, bready, lots of fruit skin and some funk. Excellent sour with a nice thick, and full mouthfeel that some sours tend to lack. The tartness, barrel and fruit work incredibly well together.

Bottle @ Triple Rock Sour Sunday, Triple Rock, Berkeley, CA. Pours a hazy golden color with a small fast disappearing off-white head. Has a fruity malty woody spicy apricot aroma. Fruity malty spicy woody slightly tart apricot flavor with hints of citrus. Has a fruity malty woody tart apricot finish.

Hazy orange pour with a tall white head. Great apricot fruitiness, some grass, and plenty of wine. A mild fruit and malt sweetness, moderate funk, and a good lactic sourness. The flavor is very bright, acidic, and crisp. Solid apricot flavor, a mild earthy funk, wine, oak, and plenty of lactic acidity and tartness. Notes of vanilla as it warms, too. Excellent beer!

Bottle. Thanks Jess.  Cloudy golden with a fizzy white head. Nice fragrant apricot, caramel, vanilla, red wine, and oak aroma. Soft, bright, creamy citric and lightly lactic palate. Tastes of tart apricot, grain, vanilla, grape, red wine, horsey notes and light oak with a nice tangy finish. Excellent.

Poured from a bottle at Triple Rock Sour Beer Sunday. Pours murky golden with no head and a strange fruity aroma. There is a subtle apricot and caramel malt flavor with a vinous finish that lingers on the palate.
Notes from the book. Tap at the brewery. Pours apricot, white head. Aroma is of fruit and apricot and sour, taste is crisp and clear.

Bottle at the brewery.  Great looking golden orange pour from the bottle with a nice thin white head.  Very strong stone fruit / apricot aroma.   Flavor is spot on: tart, dried apricot, lemon sourness, a nice amount of oak from the barrel, and some mild funk round out the glass.  A fantastic beer.

Draft at the tasting room. Pours golden orange with a thin white head. Aroma is dry stone fruit. Flavor is mild fresh apricot, a subtle malt background, tart lemon and apricot peel, and woody, tannic barrel character. Finishes dry and tart and refreshing. Really good.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2013 Batch 1: On tap at the brewery. Pours a nice pumpkin color with a wispy white head. Lactic lemon and peach aroma, lightly vinous. Flavor is tart apricots, nice and fresh, lemon pith, subtle brett, biiig oaky finish with heaps of grapes, rustic woodiness, buttery oaky wine, dry finish. 


Batch 3: From bottle at Jupiter Sour Sunday. The aroma has taken a leap forward, just tons of dried apricots. Clearly more fruit in this batch, in a good way. Flavor is tart and tannic, apricot skin galore.
